titleStmt.title: Thomas A. Berryman to James F. Robinson
CWG7804

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
Owenton Kty Nov 15/1862
Gov Robinson
Dr Sir
at a called meeting of the Board of Trustees for town of Overton held in Owenton on the day of August 1862 the following order was entered --

It appearing that L Stout having received the highest number of votes for Police judge for the town of Owenton he is duly declared Elected to said office and the said Stout having presented his resignation to the Board of Trustees it was accepted --
It is now ordered that D S Adams be appointed to fill the vacancy -- and that the same be certified to the governor for commission

A copy attest
A. J. Mason clerk

Po. Judge
D. S. Adams
Commd Nov. 24 1862
